task_description: Facing the building to your East (approx. 73°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the building’s roofline relative to its base to estimate total height, so I should tilt up while keeping the current heading toward it.
The view is no longer aimed at the target building (should be ~73°E), so I should rotate right to re-center the building while keeping the upward pitch to capture the roofline.
I need a single height estimate now, so I’ll approximate the building as ~3 stories with a flat roof and typical story heights (~3–3.5 m each) plus roof/parapet.
